author: Michael Larabel
description: GNU ddrescue as the free software data recovery tool from files or block devices is out today with a big feature release. The new GNU ddrescue 1.30 is improved by "orders of magnitude" for the automatic recovery from drives with a dead head...
title: GNU ddrescue 1.30 "Orders of Magnitude" Better In Recovery From Drives With A Dead Head

author: Michael Larabel
description: Package updates for the Arch Linux powered Manjaro Linux distribution have been pushed out for Manjaro 26.0 "Anh-Linh" while updated ISOs are expected to soon become available. The Manjaro 26.0 milestone brings KDE Plasma 6.5 and GNOME 49 but with both of those you may lose X11 session support so they are recommending their Xfce Edition for wanting wanting to continue using an X.Org desktop session...
title: Manjaro Linux 26.0 Rolling Out - Xfce Edition Recommended If Wanting To Use X11

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those with fond memories of Puppy Linux as a very lightweight Linux distribution, released last month was a new TrixiePup64 for continuing the Puppy Linux spirit atop Debian. The new TrixiePup64 is based on Debian 13 components while shipping in both X11 and Wayland flavors. Out now is TrixiePup64 2601 as the latest iteration of this lightweight Linux distribution...
title: TrixiePup64 2601 Released For Debian 13 Powered Puppy Linux In Wayland & X11 Flavors

author: Michael Larabel
description: Worked on back in 2024 for the Linux kernel was a built-in counter to keep track of the number of hung tasks since boot. That feature for keeping track of the number of hung tasks since boot was merged in Linux 6.13 and exposed via /proc/sys/kernel/hung_task_detect_count. For helping ease use around it, new code working its way to the kernel will allow resetting that "hung_task_detect_count" counter...
title: Linux's Hung Task Detector Will Be Able To Be Reset For Easing System Administration

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following Linux 6.19 adding support for CRKD guitar controllers, new patches posted to the Linux kernel mailing list are bringing some additional guitar controllers to Linux. This latest work is around enabling the Rock Band 4 guitars for the PlayStation 4 and PS5 consoles to work under Linux...
title: Patch Posted For Bringing Rock Band 4 PS4 / PS5 Guitar Support To Linux

author: Michael Larabel
description: A new feature being worked on recently for the AMDKFD kernel compute driver is batch user pointer "userptr" allocation support. With this new user-space API it will become possible to support allocating multiple non-contiguous CPU virtual address ranges that map to a single contiguous GPU virtual address...
title: New AMD Linux Driver Patches Posted For Batch Userptr Allocation Support
